score

public ScoredValue<String> score(List<Feature> features)
Description copied from interface: Classifier
Provides a way to get a score associated with a classification. The 'score' in the scored value could be anything but is often a probability. The only expectation is that a higher score should correspond to higher confidence in the classification. No other assumptions should be made.

Specified by:
score in interface Classifier<String>
Overrides:
score in class Classifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<ContextValue>>
Parameters:
features - a list of features to be classified
Returns:
the classification score

score

public List<ScoredValue<String>> score(List<Feature> features,
                                       int maxResults)
Description copied from interface: Classifier
Provides a way to get a scores associated with the top N scores for the best N classifications. The 'score' in the scored value could be anything but is often a probability. The only expectation is that a higher score should correspond to higher confidence in the classification. No other assumptions should be made.

Specified by:
score in interface Classifier<String>
Overrides:
score in class Classifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<ContextValue>>
Parameters:
features - a list of features to be classified
maxResults - the maximum number of classifications to return.
Returns:
a sorted list of the best N classifications with their scores.

isSequential

public boolean isSequential()
Description copied from interface: Classifier
A classifier that is based on a sequence of labels (i.e. computes/optimizes label transition probabilities) such as the MalletCRFClassifier should return true. Here is the expectation for implementors. If true is returned, then the classifier may or may not implement classify(List<Feature>) (usually not we expect) and must override classify(List<List<Feature>>). If false is returned, then the classifier is required to implement classify(List<Feature>) and may or many not override classify(List<List<Feature>>). If you do not want to implement classify(List<Feature>) for your sequential classifier, then simply throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
isSequential in interface Classifier<String>
Specified by:
isSequential in class Classifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<ContextValue>>
Returns:
false
See Also:
MalletCRFClassifier.isSequential(), isSequential()
